page.title: 15Carlton Curlieu
page.content: The Parish is bounded and crossed by two very ancient roads, the Gartree Road and the Durassic Way. At the t- junction in the centre of the village is a small triangular green on which is planted a mountain ash tree to commemorate the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. The parish is not heavily wooded except for the trees which shelter the village, a small spinney at Carlton Clump, Sheephorns, fox cover, a plantation on the south of the Hall. Several fox earths are to be found around the parish and all types of wild life. There is a telephone box and post box in the village. There are no shops or schools in the village. Children go by school bus to Church Langton at primary school age and to Kibworth and Market Harborough Secondary schools.
